data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/textList: "Sssstranger sssstranger, ssso niccce to sssee you again. Care for some trade?"
It seems the traveling merchant has found his way to this beacon. "Fancccy ssseeing you here, sssstranger! Got sssome new goodsss..."
"Sssstranger ssstranger, I sssee we meet again!" The merchant sticks out his tentacle, showing off several things he's stashed in his coat.
The traveling merchant waves to you as soon as you jump in. "Aaaah, ssstranger ssstranger ssstranger. Sssso good to sssee you!"
"Sssstranger ssstranger, we reunite at lasssst! Got ssssome new ssstock sssinccce the lassst time we sssaw each other..."
"Sssstranger ssstranger, why, I don't believe my eyesss! I kid, it'ssss no sssurprissse we've found each other again."
"Sssstranger ssstranger, what a coincccidenccce we meet again! Jussst a joke, why elssse do you think I came here?"
A massive and well armed Slug ship is resting here. Looks like it's the traveling merchant! "How niccce to sssee you, ssstranger! Come in, come in!"
"Ssstranger, ssssometime I'll have to tell you the ssstoriessss of my travelssss. But for now, shall we do businessss?"
A bright blue Slug hails you, a fat cigar in his mouth, but he perks up when he sees you. "Sssstranger! Why hello there! Have you come to trade?"
"Aaaah ssstranger, I figured I might ssssee you here. It'sss a fine day for ssshopping, you got a minute to ssspare?"
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/event[@n: "Alright ssstranger! Have you ever heard the tale... of the Weapon Pre-Igniter? It wassss a powerful augment firssst built by Jackssson Newman, a cccitizen of Antiquum Terrae during the Human-Mantisss war..."
Continue...

"But not too long after the Multiverssse Warsss, thisss tech wasss banned for being too powerful, too unssstable, too deadly. It'sss nigh imposssible to find one anymore, and trussst me I've tried..."
Continue...

"But you sssee ssstranger, Jackson Newman didn't actually invent thisss... he ssstole it! And from who? Why, a mysssteriousss and ancccient raccce. I know little about them, but from the legendsss they were called the Obelisssk, and usssed to rule the galaxiesss abroad. Exccciting ssstuff, eh?"
Continue...

"Don't know whatever happened to thessse 'Obelisssk' fellowsss, but I do know that remnantssss of them remain around the galaxy. I heard a man in the pub sssay sssomething about a ruin not too far from here that could even contain the Pre-Igniter tech I'm lookin for!"
Continue...

"Now I tell you what ssstranger. Jussst before thisss, I wasss 'boutta head there and grab it for myssself, but then you ssshowed up. If you take jussst one glanccce at my ssship, you know well I don't need that sssilly augment. Ssso I'll give you here thessse coordinatesss, and wisssh you besst of luck. And that'sss all ssstranger. Now, want to trade?"
Continue...
Yeah, we've heard it.
"Then why'd you assssk me to hear it again ssstranger? I'm afraid I don't have time to repeat mysssself..."
Continue...
This is the location of a quest from the Traveling Merchant.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.
You've arrived at the coordinates Sylvan gave. In the distance you can see a massive yet foreign alien vessel...
Approach.

As you move closer, a massive Rock pirate flies past, their hull adorned with all kinds of strange alien limbs. "You. You are Sylvan friend, me thinks. Who else would come to my spot, looking take bounty that belong to TREMOR THE TERRIBLE? YOU NOT QUAKE IN FEAR, TINY MAN?"
Not particularly.
"No soul ever live after challenging Tremor! I show Sylvan what I make of sending mercenary after Tremor stuff!"
Continue...
Yeah, I'd rather not fight you.
"Good choice, tiny man. Next time, tell Sylvan stay away from Tremor stuff!"
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
We can't be the only ones looking for this. Leave.
You might never see that tech that Sylvan promised, but it's better than being dead.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
"AAAAH! AAAAAAH! TREMOR DYING! TREMOR DYI- Gaaaaaaah!" Tremor and his mighty ship have fallen. You scrap its remains.
Continue...

Tremor might be dead, but your job here isn't finished. As you approach the alien structure, it becomes apparent that the sheer size of the colossal fleet ship is enough to fit a thousand-fold of your cruiser...
Continue...

You traverse the interior of the ship as sparking electronics jut out of the walls, sometimes scraping against your hull in the tighter areas. Inevitably, you find a room resembling the Weapon Control, but you're forced to travel forward on foot.
Continue...

Your crew come across a massive cubical power source plugged into the wall, which they assume to be the Pre-Igniter. However, it's uncertain whether pulling it out will trigger any sort of alarm, since the ship itself still seems to have power in a few locations. How much faith are you willing to put into the ancient alien security?
Grab the Pre-Igniter.

Your crew carefully eject the Pre-Igniter from its slot. All seems well for a few seconds until a green light starts flashing and a muffled robotic voice starts spewing out alien garble your translator can't comprehend. You quickly hurry out of the ship followed by 2 automated drones dispatched to deal with your crew!
Leave it and grab whatever salvage you can instead.
Your crew dig around and grab anything they can carry back to the ship that won't risk setting off a trap. Maybe the Pre-Igniter will be the prize of some other future explorers instead.

Tremor's crew has been crushed, and his mighty ship has attempted a desperate ramming maneuver that you hastily dodge. It ends up spectacularly smashing itself into pieces against the ruins that started this conflict...
"Alright ssstranger! Have you ever heard the tale... of the furry, one-eyed tree lizard thingssss? Ssstupid, I know, but it'sss all true I promissse. I've ssseen them with my own eyesssstalksss!"
Continue...

Sylvan chuckles. "But in all ssseriousssnesss, there'sss a colony of friendly yet primitive creaturesss nearby. However, they've been through tough timesss lately. Hektar Indussstriesss, perhapsss you've heard of them, have been taking advantage of them for ssseveral yearsss, ssstealing them away for lessss-than-willing labor." You take note at the particular emphasis of disdain when Sylvan mentions "Hektar."
Continue...

"When I caught word of thisss, I ssstepped in. I can't watch over them forever, ssso I had a friend of mine, a Zoltan monk named Anurak, ssstand guard. However, I haven't heard from him in weeksss. I'm getting worried, but I'm kind of held up with thisss merchant busssinesss. Could you be a friend, sssstranger, and take a quick look? It would mean a lot."
Sure.
"Many thankssss, ssstranger!"
Continue...
Decline.
"That'ssss alright, ssstranger. No hard feelingssss."
Continue...
Yeah, we've heard it.
"Then why'd you assssk me to hear it again ssstranger? I'm afraid I don't have time to repeat mysssself..."
Continue...
This is the location of a quest from the Traveling Merchant.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

You've arrived at the coordinates Sylvan gave. You can see a large populated planet in the distance with several massive structures spanning across the trees on the surface. If these lizards really are against advanced technology as Sylvan claims, this is quite an impressive accomplishment.
Approach.

As you land on the planet, you can see the citizens are in total disarray and hardly even notice your ship. Unsure of how to communicate, you let out a loud shout to draw their attention. It startles most of the nearby inhabitants, who turn to face your ship.
Er, hello. Has anyone seen Anurak?

The leader of the group steps forwards, who introduces himself as Guntput. Fortunately, your translator seems to be able to pick up their language easily, but unfortunately the news you're given isn't great. "Anurak was killed, Rebel attack. Needless casualty, but nothing can be done. Without him, no communications with Zoltan peacekeepers. Hektar Industries sending fleet, they've begun their evil business again."
What evil business?

"We make good workers. Hektar need cheap employees. Simple as that. Guild once help them, but vile Irwin ejected from position of chairman when secret get out. If the Federation seeks to protect galaxy as they claim, then you will stay and defend our people. We understand it is detriment to you, we will offer a reward."
Stay to defend the lizards from Hektar.

Not too long after, a Hektar ship appears. When they see you, they don't back off, but they do seem reproachful. "Errr... you aren't ssssupposssed to be here. Thisss planet isss under ownership of Hektar Indussstriesss(tm). We apologize for the inconvenience."
This is a Zoltan sector. You're Slugs.
"Uhhh, oh whatever. How much I gotta pay you so you buzzzzz off? Thesssse lizzzardsss aren't worth your damn time."
Accept their bribe.
Undoubtedly, you have damned these lizards to life in the Hektar sweat shops. But who cares? Money!
Attack the Hektar ship.
You aren't some corrupt Zoltan politician looking to be bought off with some scrap. You have morals (probably) and you'll do all you can to defend these lizards!
Continue...
Refuse and leave.
Don't interfere with the lizard people.
Piloting an advanced, FTL equipped and Multiverse traveling vessel through territory populated by technology hating primitives might not have a good impact on their civilization.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.

The Hektar ship has been destroyed, but it's very likely more will come. Guntput expresses the same concern. "One down, but many more to come. Inevitable full enslavement of our people... we are in dark days."
Offer to take as many as you can with you.

The lizards seem hesitant. "Technology dangerous to our ways of life. Technology leads to warring, to violence. We must not taint our culture with your sins. How could we be certain you are not the next Hektar, coming swoop us up and exploit for money?"
You're right, technology is dangerous. That's why you want to be on the winning side.

The lizards glare at you with their singular eye. "You are as bad as Hektar, or Rebels! We not come with you!" You're shocked by this sudden resistance but the Lizards refuse to join you. You have no choice but to leave them behind.
We're no threat. We'll drop your people off at the nearest station.

The lizards quickly gather to discuss, but when another Hektar ship jumps in behind them and sends an entire neighborhood plummeting off of its tree, they quickly scurry aboard your vessel. You fly away, unnoticed by the approaching Hektar fleet.
Continue...

It doesn't take too long until you encounter a Zoltan trading hub willing to take the refugees. It's only a small subset of their people, but it's enough to keep their species alive for now. All but Guntput remains, who lingers on your ship.
Continue...

"Federation. You have done good service for my people. I do not foresee... good future for them. But still better than in Hektar labor camp for rest of days. I will not go with them. I have failed them as leader. I will serve you instead, in efforts to save reality and someday free rest of my people."
We've done what we can, but we must leave.
Unfortunately, the lizards are too disorganized to offer any sort of a reward, so you're forced to leave empty handed save for the scrap from the Hektar wreck.

"Alright ssstranger! Have you ever heard the tale... of the triple headed planet eating ssssnake monssster? No?! Haha of courssse not. I made it up. Ahhh I don't got a ssstory to tell thisss time, but I did sssee sssomething pretty cool! Doesss that count asss a ssstory? I think it doesss, ssstranger..."
Continue...

"Now, I'm ssssure by now you've become acquaintanced with the Morphsss, yess? Perhapsss what you didn't know however issss their ssshipss are made up'a many Morphssss all bunched together cosssier than two loversss after a full night of... ah well, nevermind. Anywaysss, thessse ssshipss tend to resssemble that of exisssting Ssshell design, but I happened to catch ssssight of one that ssstood out to me..."
Continue...

"A cruissser! Bet you're familiar with thossse, ssstranger! Didn't come here looking for an unlock from ol' Ssssylvan now, did you? Now, it ain't gonna be peachesss and rosssess. It don't take no geniusss to reckon you gotta recover that ssship unharmed ssssomehow. Now, I hypothesssize there'sss a couple waysss to pull thisss off..."
Continue...

"The firsst, and most obvioussss of courssse is killing off all the Morphsss. Sssshould be sssimple enough... excccept for the fact that thing'ssss bound to be teeming with all ssssortsss of them. No oxygen either, makesss it real tricky. The sssecond, you find sssome miracle and learn how to underssstand thessse thingsss and convinccce them to give you their ssship. Good luck with that. Three, and my persssonal favorite, you bring them sssomeone they will lisssten to. Heard there'ssss sssome big one called OOJ MAJOO, you gotta ssshout it like that you ssssee, who'sss ssstill around thessse partsss. Sssomewhere around Site Alpha, I think."
Continue...
"Now, I'll give you the coordinatessss to thisss cruissser. I believe in you, ssstranger! Anywayssss, now that'sss out of the way... wanna trade?"
Continue...
Yeah, we've heard it.
"Then why'd you assssk me to hear it again ssstranger? I'm afraid I don't have time to repeat mysssself..."
Continue...
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/ship[@na: The Morph cruiser has been destroyed. Unfortunately, this means there's no way to recover the ship now, but you can scrap the wreckage.
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/event[@n: This is the location of a quest from the Traveling Merchant.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.
You've arrived at the coordinates Sylvan gave. It looks like his information was correct, as always, as you spot the massive Morph vessel nearby.
Approach.
You move closer, and the cruiser instinctively raises its weapons. "Makoo! Juka yip yip rool!" If you had to guess, they want an explanation for why you're following them.
Try to communicate.

You drop down to your knees, imitating the jiggling of the Morphs, letting out several chirps and unsavory noises while hopping up and down. When you get off the ground to look at the reaction of the Morphs, they haven't moved an inch. "Urm... Poo roo...?"
"Poo roo!"
"POO ROO! POO ROO! POO ROO!" shouts the Morphs, who begin to wiggle in unison, then rotating around in a circular fashion. "POO ROO! POO ROO! POO ROO!"
Continue...
"Kur kur tig." The Morphs stop circling, then go back to working aboard their ship. Looks like this was all a waste of time.
Attack!
"Atoo atoo! Yrill took took!" The Morphs prepare for combat, and you should do the same.
Continue...
Leave them alone.
(OOJ MAJOO) "Pik pik yurla spoo too!"
Attack!
"Atoo atoo! Yrill took took!" The Morphs prepare for combat, and you should do the same.
Continue...
Avoid the Morph ship.
You don't feel prepared for this fight. Maybe under different circumstances you could have fought it, but right now you have other things to worry about.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.
We aren't prepared for this.
You just aren't ready for this fight. Alas, it must wait for another day.
Do something on-board the ship.
Do nothing.

As soon as they hear the voice of OOJ MAJOO, their leader, all of the Morphs stop. After some more gibberish back and forth, the Morphs transfer over some data for the ship blueprints. It looks like... genetic code... but you aren't one to question.
Continue...
Before you leave, the Morphs offer you a gift of good faith.

The Morph cruiser has been emptied of crew. It feels... unusual, walking around in the squishy, semi-organic interior as you head to the cockpit and reprogram the ship to head back to the Federation hangar. You wonder what the Federation will think when it gets there...
Continue...
Before you leave, you stop by the cargo bay of the Morph ship. Inside you find a ton of scrap, and a strange Morph that you scoop up and bring onto the ship.
This is the location of the Traveling Merchant.
Explored location. Nothing left of interest.
Scans show that Sylvan should be here as usual, but where his ship once was is now a smoking wreck! What kind of monstrous vessel could have dethroned Sylvan?
Investigate closer...

As you pull closer, a strangely familiar vessel uncloaks nearby, followed by an equally familiar voice. "Long time no see, beyatch! You thought you were rid of me, you thought you could run, you thought you could hide... but NO! I have found you! Me, YOUR ARCH NEMESIS! MWAHAHAHAH!"
We know each other?
"Seriously? You don't remember me? It's ME! The one who's almost killed you hundred times before! I've been following you since the beginning of your journey! How do you NOT remember me?"
Oohhhh yeah, you're Leo!

"WHAT?! That's a GUY'S name! I'm LEAH! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Uhhhh... oh right, you're Lizzy!

"WHAT?! I'm LEAH! Lizzy is a stupid name! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Ah, I remember. You must be Leilani!

"WHAT?! I'm LEAH! Leilani is a stupid name! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Ah, I remember. You must be Liam!

"WHAT?! That's a GUY'S name! I'm LEAH! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Ah, I remember. You must be Leviticus!

"WHAT?! What kind of stupid ass name is Leviticus! That's a guy's name! I'm LEAH! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Too late to do anything.
You fly away, hoping you never have to encounter the ship responsible for this.
Do something onboard the ship.
Do nothing.

"Oh shut up. You aren't sorry for anything. I thought we had something going. Like, one of those cool rivalries you see in movies. But all this time, you didn't give a single shit about me. Well guess what! I've learned a thing or two from our past encounters. See, the reason I could never beat you was because time after time I specialized in only one thing. But those days are over. New ship, new guns, new armor. I've already killed your little Slug friend. And now, it's time I finally put an end to this little facade of mine by killing you."
Continue...

Suddenly, a strangely familiar vessel uncloaks nearby, followed by an equally familiar voice. "Long time no see, beyatch! You thought you were rid of me, you thought you could run, you thought you could hide... but NO! I have found you! Me, YOUR ARCH NEMESIS! MWAHAHAHAH!"
We know each other?
"Seriously? You don't remember me? It's ME! The one who's almost killed you hundred times before! I've been following you since the beginning of your journey! How do you NOT remember me?"
Oohhhh yeah, you're Leo!

"WHAT?! That's a GUY'S name! I'm LEAH! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Uhhhh... oh right, you're Lizzy!

"WHAT?! I'm LEAH! Lizzy is a stupid name! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Ah, I remember. You must be Leilani!

"WHAT?! I'm LEAH! Leilani is a stupid name! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Ah, I remember. You must be Liam!

"WHAT?! That's a GUY'S name! I'm LEAH! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?
Ah, I remember. You must be Leviticus!

"WHAT?! What kind of stupid ass name is Leviticus! That's a guy's name! I'm LEAH! I... I thought you were joking. All of this time, I keep fighting you. I follow you to the ends of the Multiverse, rematch after rematch. And despite all of that, you couldn't even bother so much as to remember my name?"
Er... sorry?

"Oh shut up. You aren't sorry for anything. I thought we had something going. Like, one of those cool rivalries you see in movies. But all this time, you didn't give a single shit about me. Well guess what! I've learned a thing or two from our past encounters. See, the reason I could never beat you was because time after time I specialized in only one thing. But those days are over. New ship, new guns, new armor. Now, it's time I finally put an end to this little facade of mine by killing you."
Continue...

"I... I still lost... Even with all of that... I wasn't a match for you. Well... see you in the next life, beyatch..." Leah falls to the ground, and for the first time, she doesn't beam away. Your nemesis is finally dead.

"I... I still lost... Even with all of that... I wasn't a match for you. Well... see you in the next life, beyatch..." Leah falls to the ground, and for the first time, she doesn't beam away. Your nemesis is finally dead.
Inspect the merchant's ship.

It seems Sylvan is in horrible condition. Leah might have been stronger than before, but there's no way she single handedly killed him. Sylvan must have already been worn down by the fleet of Obelisk and Aces to get here. You aren't sure if you can save him.
There's nothing we can do.

You know you can't save him, but you can at least make the merchant's final moments comfortable. "Ssstranger, thisss isss the end. I want you... to have thissss... You're the Multiverssse'ssss biggessst badassss now. Go make me proud."
(Obyn) "My dearest Sylvan!"

"You weren't wrong Obyn... we did ssssee each other again..." Sylvan puts his hand to his chest, as if feeling if he still has a pulse. His face shows a look of disappointment at what he feels. "I don't have much longer, Obyn. Do you remember that sssship we sssaid we would build together? Well... I finisssshed it. The blueprintsss in my cargo bay. If there'ssss one thing I can trussst about my ssship, it'sss that the cargo bay alwaysss sssurvivesss the fight..."
Continue...

"Thank you sssstranger, for reuniting me with Obyn one lassst time. It hassss been an honor. There'sss a little extra sssomething in that cargo bay for you." Sylvan turns to Obyn one last time. "Obyn... I love you. Goodbye." And with that, the traveling merchant slumps over unconscious. Obyn's tears mark stains on his robes, and you aren't sure if you can do anything to save him.
There's nothing we can do. Go check the cargo bay.
(Adv. Medbay) Save him.

You rush Sylvan to the Medbay to be healed. Once he's in a stable condition, he thanks you. Sylvan and Obyn have another one of their awkward distant hugs, and then Sylvan turns to you. "Well, ssstranger. Guessss we better check on that cargo, then go sssave reality, eh?"
Go check the cargo bay.
(Adv. Clone Bay) Save him.

You rush to register Sylvan in your Clone Bay. Once his clone emerges from it, he thanks you. Sylvan and Obyn have another one of their awkward distant hugs, and then Sylvan turns to you. "Well, ssstranger. Guessss we better check on that cargo, then go sssave reality, eh?"
Go check the cargo bay.
(Reconstructive Teleporter) Save him.

You quickly beam back Sylvan and allow the regenerative effects of the teleporter to kick in. Sylvan and Obyn have another one of their awkward distant hugs, and then Sylvan turns to you. "Well, ssstranger. Guessss we better check on that cargo, then go sssave reality, eh?"
Go check the cargo bay.
(Billy) Billy seems to want to say something.

Billy rushes over to Sylvan, shaking him, trying to lift him off the floor. "Come on brother, don't die here! Oh, how could I let ussss grow ssso apart, I'm ssssuch a fool. An assshole... Pleassse Sssylvan, don't let our sssaga end here before I had a chanccce to redeem myssself."
Continue...

Sylvan tries to sit up, but groans in pain. "Even to the lassst minute, you care more about yourssself. You drove me away from Hektar jussst ssso you could keep up your little sssslave trade with that bassstard Irwin. And look where that got both of you."
Continue...
Billy starts sobbing uncontrollably. "I know, I know. Pleasssse Sssylvan, I can't watch you die. I don't want to lossse my brother, you're the only perssson who ever wasss by my ssside."
Continue...

data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/textList: It appears you aren't alone! A fellow multiverse traveler, this time a Rebel, has already found their way to this beacon, and is moving in on your location.
You were aware the Rebels had been finding their way into this sector, but you didn't expect to see a Multiverse-drive equipped vessel defending this beacon!
It appears you aren't the only ship at this beacon, nor the only ship with a Multiverse-Drive here either! A hostile Multiverse Rebel ship has spotted you and is moving in to attack.

"Haha! At last we have found you. It only took 768 different realities full of chocolate pudding or shape-shifting god aliens to find you here!" A beat up Multiverse Rebel ship moves in, weapons armed and ready.
A confident Rebel captain of the nearby Multiverse ship boasts about his abilities at tracking you down, and swiftly gives his crew orders to attack. You figure you should do the same.

The Rebel ship at this beacon looks like it has been through a lot... and for good reason! It's a ship from across the Multiverse, and it seems they've tracked you down to this beacon and are looking for a fight.
The Rebels are a common sight all around the galaxy, but the ship here is no ordinary Rebel. They appear to be a Multiverse-Drive equipped vessel, and they've decided to engage you in combat!
"You're that Universe 0 bloke! Haha, we've got you now. You're one hard fellow to track down, but in the end, the Rebellion will always win!"

A Rebel Multiverse ship approaches. "You son of a buzzard, do you know how many realities we had to suffer through until we found you? This is like, the 9th version of myself to pilot the 16th version of this ship! So quit running and just die!"
You're amazed at the amounts of effort these Rebels go to tracking you down. A Rebel ship in poor condition bears down on you, determined not to let you past.
A mute Rebel officer fumbles, performing lazy sign language your translator slowly converts to verbal communication. "A Free Mantis ripped out my tongue. I blame you. Now I'm going to kill you."

You receive a hail from an overweight Rebel. "I was an MFK Ace you know, but then I took a Bio-Beam to the knee. But if I can kill you... maybe Vance will give me another chance!" You suspect he's lying, but you don't have time to refute his claim.
The pastel blue hull of a Rebel MV vessel glides past. As soon as they spot you, they power up their weapons and engage!
A Rebel ship comes screaming into the system... literally. The captain is shouting at the top of his lungs. Some of these Rebels are complete nuts; it looks like you'll have to crack another one.

"Straight out of Universe 1, and the first thing I find is a Federation Renegade? My luck is never this good! Promotion, here I come..." Seems you'll have to prove this isn't quite the lucky encounter he's looking forward to.

A Rebel captain appears on the vidscreen, chewing on a squirming bowl of young Orchids. "While tracking you down, we ran out of food. Now I'm stuck eating these gross baby things. Please, just let me kill you, so I can go find some food that doesn't cry when I bite it."

A nearby Multiverse travelling Rebel ship broadcasts an automated message; "Glory to the Rebellion!" You remember the time when the Rebels cared enough to actually say it themselves. At least, you get to blow them up all the same.

Most of the Rebel forces sent from Universe 1 are ships like these. Strangely, you don't encounter many of them outside of random chance like this; you suppose the Rebellion keeps its Warp-Bays somewhere else. Regardless, a challenger is beckoning, and you aren't going to disappoint!

You've heard Admiral Vance has some kind of personal grudge against Renegades, and so the Rebellion relies on its signature blue-clad MV Rebels to carry the burden of the invasion. You wonder how it feels to jump out of U1 just to face down a ship like yours. You're sure glad you don't.

"I used to be a Fed during the Civil War in U1. But after the U0 invasion began... well... you either became a Rebel or you accepted your death or enslavement. If things had turned out differently... well... I hope you understand none of this is personal."
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/event[@n: Continue...
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/textList: "It's okay... I saw this... coming..." The Rebel captain collapses as their ship breaks apart around them. If they saw this coming, they should have thought twice about messing with you. Good riddance.
"I guess I'm not getting that promotion after all. Darn." The last look of disappointment in themselves is erased as the Rebel's body is thrown out into the abyss as their ship is destroyed.

Another Rebel turned to dust. Whether it's the signature orange of mainstay Rebels or the blue of these specialized invaders, a dead Rebel is the only good Rebel. With a couple exceptions, of course. You'd fancy a Rebel who gave you free scrap; that'd be a good Rebel for sure.
From amidst the explosions you receive one last hail; "Is it too late to be sorry? It is? Damn..."
It's a very small dent you've made in the Rebellion's MV fleet, but you weren't paid to do this either. Let's just hope the Flagship falls as easily as these ships do by the time you get there.
"It's okay... I saw this... coming..." The Rebel captain collapses. If they saw this coming, they should have thought twice about messing with you. Good riddance.
"I guess I'm not getting that promotion after all. Darn." The last look of disappointment in themselves is erased as the Rebel captain falls over dead.

Another Rebel turned to dust. Whether it's the signature orange of mainstay Rebels or the blue of these specialized invaders, a dead Rebel is the only good Rebel. With a couple exceptions, of course. You'd fancy a Rebel who gave you free scrap; that'd be a good Rebel for sure.
Though the last life signs aboard the Rebel ship are quickly fading, you receive one last hail; "Is it too late to be sorry? It is? Damn..."
It's a very small dent you've made in the Rebellion's MV fleet, but you weren't paid to do this either. Let's just hope the Flagship falls as easily as these ships do by the time you get there.

data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/textList: "At least... when I'm dead... I won't have to look at your stupid face anymore..."
The Multiverse ship has ceased to function, sending out a mist of blue vapor from what was their drive. You scrap their ship.
"Ah shit, guess I'm dead now." The Renegade's vessel promptly shuts down.
You've sent another crew of Renegades to the great multiverse in the sky. You hope this doesn't end up being you someday down the line instead.
The Renegade has met their untimely end. That'll teach the galaxy not to mess with the likes of you.
In the end, this ship wasn't much different from you. All the same, they're the dead ones, and you aren't.
The defeat of this vessel marks another victory for you and your crew. You hold a celebratory toast in hopes to more successful battles after salvaging the wreck.
"Aaaaaaghghghghghgh," moans the enemy captain. He gasps for air, then falls over dead. The enemy is no more.
Some day, you might earn enough of a name for yourself that these ships stop trying to mess with you. But for now, you can cross another set of pillagers off the list.
You can't imagine what your kill count will be by the end of your mission, and frankly you aren't sure you want to find out. Still, there's nothing stopping you from salvaging these latest remains.
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/eventLis: As you start to leave, you do one more once over of the wreckage and are surprised to find an item left behind that you missed!
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/event[@n: Accept their surrender.
Accept their surrender.
Accept their surrender.
Accept their surrender.
Accept their surrender.
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/textList: "Ahhh crap crap crap! We surrender, stop firing for the love of Newton's Third Law!"
The ship sends several images of a white flag to you. You figure that's a good sign that they wish to surrender.
"Ok, we messed up. But if you kill us, well that's just not very cool man."
"Look, this was a bit of a mistake. Let us go, and we promise we'll never make this mistake again. Probably."
"I'm a fellow Renegade like you! Surely you understand we only wanted scrap! It was a mistake messing with you, take this and let us live!"
The ship hails you, their captain soliciting a... favor for your 'pleasure' in turn for letting them live. When you express your disinterest, they offer something of more monetary value instead.
The enemy hails you, speaking a mess of untranslated garble. "Apologies, I forgot to turn my translator on again." The captain pauses. "AAAAAAAAAAAAAH DON'T KILL US DON'T KILL US!"
"Do you know who I am? If you kill me, my 37 wives will be absolutely devastated! Please spare me, for their sake! But also mostly mine!"

"I have traveled thousands of realities and no ship has ever fared so well against me as you. You have earned the right to not be killed by me. Please stop." The enemy captain sounds triumphant, but you can see the fear in his eyes.
"God, this is worse than the time we had to fight off an infestation of parasitic bat-worms! I can't believe I'm saying this, but we surrender!"
"We will not surrender! Okay that's a lie, we surrender. I really don't want to die."
"Ugh, I can't believe I've been brought to my knees by such an ugly bastard like you. Will you take our surrender, so my legend doesn't have to end in such a disappointing manner?"
"I'm too pretty to die! Wait, maybe I can buy this stupid idiot off with some junk... wait, is my mic on?" The ship goes silent, followed by an offer of surrender.
"Great, another scar for my face. I'd like to live past today, even if it means I'm going to be the mutilated amputee that you've left me as. Can I buy your mercy perhaps?"
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/event[@n: Suddenly, a massive wormhole opens around the Renegade ship. With an immense size it consumes the ship whole and then quickly closes, leaving you alone at the beacon.
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/textList: "Federation, you are the next of many kills that I foresee in my future! Let us duel!"
"What a disgusting ship you have there! I shall be doing the Multiverse a favor by ridding it from existence."
"A fellow Renegade? A true pleasure to meet you here, new friend! Now die."
"Crap, this isn't the solid gold reality. Oh, there's a ship here. Men, get ready for battle!"

"Where the hell are we? This is what we get for not using a warp-bay... wait, Federation? God damn it, we're in another one of those civil war realities. Looks like we're fighting our way out of this one!"
A Multiverse ship jumps in a few seconds later, ready to pillage. There's no other option but to fight!
"Bow down to me, foolish ship! This reality now belongs to us!" You doubt any ship could conquer an entire reality on their own, but regardless it's time for a fight!
"Apologies stranger, it's really nothing personal that we have to kill you. Scrap's a hard commodity to come by! Well not really, but you can never have enough."
"Don't even bother trying to run, Federation! Your ship is forfeit to me now! Hahahah!"
From out of the tunnel comes a foreboding, yet strangely colored Renegade ship. It looks like talking it out isn't an option, because their guns are already firing!

It's a common philosophy among Renegades that all scrap they can get their hands on belongs to them. You're guilty of this quite often as well, but now another Renegade has arrived and sees you as their next target!
"Hello there, friend! I have a gift for you, would you like to see it?" You reluctantly ask what it is, only to be met by them charging forward in an offensive attack!
"Haha, I am but 4 parallel universes ahead of you! But I will not have won until I've defeated you in EVERY universe! Yahoo!" The ship moves in to attack.

"You have to help me. No matter where I go, people keep calling me a Renegade. HOW DO THEY KNOW?! My name is Dan, I work in real estate, I just bought this ship to give it a test spin, and now everyone wants to kill me. And... and I want to kill everyone! Something's terribly wro-AGH! GIVE ME YOUR MONEY OR DIE!"

"One Renegade to another, my luck's kinda gone to shit. I heard a rumor, a myth really... but when a Renegade dies, supposedly you wake up in another body and start all over again. Frankly, I'm kind of hoping you kill me. Who knows, maybe some day I'll wake up as you! Hahah! Heh..."

"You'll never believe what I just came back from! I swear to god, there was this like, big place at the center of everything. There was a talking can of beans, and god himself, except he was a Slug with a big ring... and there was a guy in a maid outfit, and a guy with a card that smelled weird, and... and they were ALL SLUGS. I'M GOING INSANE!" The deranged Renegade raises his weapons, turning to violence in his madness.

It's strange, seeing so many Renegades around nowadays. A long time ago, there only used to be a few; it certainly wasn't a popular title. But something about the adventure has drawn more people in. As the newcomer approaches you however, it seems one of your adventures is about to end.

"Father, is that you?! Have you come back to me? You old coot, I hate you! Get out of my LIFE!" You have no idea what the Renegade on the other end is talking about, but whether they're your child or not, they're about to see the business end of your guns.
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/event[@n: Continue...
Use your blessing to avoid combat.
data/events_multiverse.xml$/FTL/textList: A Renegade approaches, demanding you give them tribute. Will you give in to their demands, or fight your way through?
"Ah, what a welcome surprise to see a fellow Renegade! Unfortunately, I think you have something we want..."
"Stop right there, Federation vessel! We claim this beacon for our own, and you're in our territory! You'll have to give us tribute if you want to pass."
A Multiverse ship threatens you nearby, and it seems you might find yourself in a fight soon unless you can satisfy them with a tribute.

"Ah, I see you've already found your way to this reality. I'm sure you've found your collection of riches, and have plenty to share with us, right?" You suspect this is more than just a friendly request when their weapons swivel to face you!

To most, this would be nothing but a frivolous and worthless gesture, but to the Eargen military, whose ships are strong but outdated, such decorations denote a level of tech above the typical par.
Continue...

"I MUST FEEEEED! AAAGH! You- you have POWER!, yes? Give it all to me. Mmmm power, your power is MINE! AGH! HAND IT OVER!" The crazed Leech begins to salivate rapidly, making you glad you're standing on the other end of a screen instead of face to face. You fail to convince the Leech that you can't exactly "hand over" the power, and so he decides to come aboard and take it himself!
Continue...
Pay tribute in scrap to avoid the fight.
Fortunately, the MV ship accepts the tribute in turn for letting you live.
